head.title: More Than 300 Arrested At Marijuana March

hedline.hl1: More Than 300 Arrested At Marijuana March

abstract.p: Several thousand protesters calling for legalization of marijuana march down Broadway; more than 300 are arrested after lighting up for their cause (S)

block.p: Several thousand protesters calling for the legalization of marijuana marched down Broadway to Battery Park yesterday, where more than 300 were arrested after lighting up for their cause.

The police said most of those arrested were charged with misdemeanor marijuana possession. The march began at noon at Broadway and Houston Street, as the protesters, chanting ''weed,'' and ''legalize it,'' marched behind a large red banner reading ''Stop The Drug War.''
Several thousand protesters calling for the legalization of marijuana marched down Broadway to Battery Park yesterday, where more than 300 were arrested after lighting up for their cause.

The police said most of those arrested were charged with misdemeanor marijuana possession. The march began at noon at Broadway and Houston Street, as the protesters, chanting ''weed,'' and ''legalize it,'' marched behind a large red banner reading ''Stop The Drug War.''

The rally was organized by several groups, including Cures Not Wars, the National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws, the Black Coalition on Drugs, the Cannabis Action Network and Legalize!

One large group began forming in Washington Square Park before joining the marchers. As the group formed, police patrolling in the area warned the crowd over bullhorns that anyone using illegal substances would be arrested.
